result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Richard Coleman Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by March 1, 2024.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Richard Coleman Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Richard Coleman Jr in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Robert Richard Coleman Jr.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst for Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court ordered defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction, with 3 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Restitution set at $0.00.
-Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by March 1, 2024.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

*Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed: Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, DNA Collection.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert Richard Coleman in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Robert Richard Coleman in court, appear by video with attorney Connor Romenesko, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Robert Richard Coleman in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Robert Richard Coleman in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Richard Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
